Hi everyone!
I want to show that theorem pow_of_pow (n m : â„•){M : Type u}(x : M)[monoid M] : (x ^ n) ^ m = x ^ (n * m) := sorry I wonder is there a tactic to solve this quickly? Or is this already written somewhere in the mathlib3? Or I have to prove this using induction on natural numbers? I find that I need to spend much time on statements about monoids (more precisely, linear_ordered_comm_monoid_with_zero) when I want to discuss local fields, extension of valuations, etc. I wonder is there something as powerful as the tactic ring that applies to monoids? Thank you very much!

Here's how to play this game:

  • Look at the LHS of the lemma. It's ^ twice, and that symbol is called pow. So docs#pow_pow?
  • That didn't work. Try again on the RHS. It's ^ with * on the right; so try docs#pow_mul. Success!

If you haven't already, check out #naming
